abstract.p: S Kinzler letter says New Jersey Legislature should have established marriage as option for same-sex couples, not just civil union (April 13 article)

block.p: ''Equality Elusive Under New Jersey Civil Union Law'' (news article, April 13) shows the confusion and lack of recognition and benefits that couples in civil unions face versus their straight-couple counterparts.

''Equality Elusive Under New Jersey Civil Union Law'' (news article, April 13) shows the confusion and lack of recognition and benefits that couples in civil unions face versus their straight-couple counterparts.
My partner and I had our civil union on April 11. Happily sporting our commitment rings, we took our golden lab to the vet that evening.

As my partner meandered around Pet Smart, I stood by and made sure that our baby was taken care of. The vet came out from the examination room, looked around for my partner and then asked me, ''Where is your sister, or is that your friend?'' I responded, ''You mean my wife?'' She chuckled and said, ''Oh, I'm sorry.''
There are many occasions where I feel that we must fight to be recognized as a couple.

Marriage is recognized as a commitment. Most people we meet cannot get with the ''civil union'' phrase. At that point, I simply share that we are married. Bingo! The lights go on, and the puzzling looks ensue. Then a brief explanation of same-sex legislation, and we are good to go!
Shame on the New Jersey Legislature for failing to call our union a marriage!
S. Kinzler Hasbrouck Heights, N.J. April 18, 2007
The writer is an advocate for Garden State Equality.
